POWERED by FUSION

An individual post follows.

Apple Sexiness Roundup

Steve Jobs has been busy at Macworld San Fransisco. Announced today: both
"12"":http://www.apple.com/powerbook/index12.html and (!!!)
"17"":http://www.apple.com/powerbook/index17.html PowerBook G4s, with onboard Bluetooth; Airport
Extreme, Apple’s name for the higher-speed,
backwards-compatible 802.11g technology that pushes the existing 802.11b wireless up to 54Mbps and
tacks on better security; a whipass-fast new web browser called
Safari; a slick new PowerPoint competitor called
Keynote, and even their own distribution of the
X11 *nixland graphics layer. Crazy busy Apple.

—Jan 07, 2003
